narrative=Ricky Smith was reported missing when he failed to arrive at his regular yoga class, which was part of his routine to manage ongoing mental health issues. Friends noted personality changes in the weeks leading up to his disappearance. Ricky was last seen at a train station near his workplace, where he seemed agitated. Before disappearing, he had stopped by his former boarding school and appeared disoriented according to a witness. His friend reported that he had intended to take a train back to his hometown but never arrived. After several days of searching, the police successfully traced Ricky to an address in Crail. He was safe but confused, indicating he had experienced a mental health crisis, which contributed to his sudden disappearance.

narrative=Ricky Smith, age 30, was reported missing from his home at 54 Nethergate South, Crail. Known for his regular routine involving medical appointments and a yoga class, Ricky's disappearance was uncharacteristic and unexpected. Prior to going missing, Ricky mentioned to his aunt, Amanda Smith, that he had planned to visit the train station for an undetermined purpose. His absence was first noticed when he failed to attend his workplace meeting, which was unusual for him. Concerned, his sister, Sandra Smith, reached out to authorities. After extensive searches, Ricky was eventually located by police at an address in Crail, safe and unharmed. The circumstances of his disappearance remained unclear, but there was relief in his safe return.

narrative=Ricky Smith was reported missing after a series of unusual behaviors had friends and neighbors concerned. Prior to his disappearance, Ricky exhibited significant personality changes, withdrawing from social interactions, and often seemed distracted and anxious. He secretly cut off communications with most people, including his friend Rachael. Concern escalated when Ricky disconnected the utilities at his last known location, 7 Dorran Square, KY6 3DU, before leaving. His sudden vanishing act from the area sparked worry, especially given his reserved behavior. Despite a thorough search, initial leads pointed to 9 Darney Terrace, Kinghorn, KY3 9RF, but he wasn't found until later in Rosyth.

narrative=Ricky Smith, an aid worker, was reported missing after abrupt personality changes noted by a friend. Initially disappearing from 54 Nethergate South, Crail, concern grew as his mental health issues were recognized. Ricky was last seen at the local train station, where his friend witnessed him acting erratically and expressing a desire to escape pressures of his boarding school commitments. His disappearance heightened anxiety, especially as a lack of communication persisted. Authorities were involved and after a rigorous search, Ricky was traced two days later in Burntisland, with police finding him safe. His return marked the end of a distressing episode tied to mental health challenges.

narrative=Ricky Smith was a boarder at a renowned school near Brighton & Hove when he was reported missing. Before disappearing, he took the unusual step of disconnecting all utilities at his residence, suggesting a deliberate departure. His friend noted that Ricky seemed withdrawn in the days leading up to his disappearance and mentioned he needed a break. On the day he was last seen, Ricky visited a nearby train station but purchased no ticket, indicating he may have been contemplating something significant. After being reported missing, Ricky was found wandering along Lochies Road in Burntisland by a member of the public. His actions suggested a temporary escape rather than a desire to vanish entirely.

narrative=Ricky Smith was last seen leaving his home at 54 Nethergate South, Crail, having had an emotionally difficult week characterized by significant mental health issues. Before his disappearance, he took the unusual step of disconnecting all utilities at his home, a decision that left his family, including his sister Sandra Smith, deeply concerned. Despite normally keeping in touch, Ricky cut off communications entirely, prompting Sandra and their aunt Amanda to contact authorities. Police traced Ricky to 1 Findlay Crescent, Rosyth, where he was known to have previously attended a yoga class. Concern over the disconnected utilities and the abrupt end to his communications heightened the urgency, although ultimately, Ricky was found safe by the police at 10-16 Wood Place, Rosyth.
